thread.title: Adele's rumoured $24,000 per week Sydney residence
thread.title_full: Adele's rumoured $24,000 per week Sydney residence | Daily Mail Online

author: Alex Michael For Daily Mail Australia
title: Adele's rumoured $24,000 per week Sydney residence
text:
Adele is known for singing songs of loss and longing.
Now, it's been rumoured that the 28-year-old is renting a lavish Sydney crash pad that's been home to more than its fair share of heartbreak.
Yahoo7 Be reported on Tuesday that the multi-Grammy winner is renting the $24,000 per week mansion used in early seasons of The Bachelor Australia.
Scroll Down For Video.
Adele's house? Adele is rumoured to be renting 'Clifton,' the same Sydney Mansion from the early seasons of The Bachelor Australia, with a price tag of at least $24,000 per week
The Hunters Hill property, known as 'Clifton' was described by the publication as one of Sydney's 'Stateliest' mansions.
Adele is reportedly using the pad as her home base for her multi-state Australian tour.
According to the article, the stunning sandstone building was linked to the UK-songstress after she was spotted 'shopping for toys at Kidstuff in nearby Lane Cove'.
Blake Garvey famously broke Sam Frost's heart at the residence, where the Hello singer may now be staying alongside her entourage and adorable four-year-old Angelo.
Calling Australia home: The 28-year-old is reportedly using the pad as her home base for her multi-state Australian tour
Check this out: If the growing rumours are true, the singer will be be saying hello to an indoor space boasting ornate chandeliers dangling from ceilings and a main hallway that features a marble checkered floor
If the growing rumours are true, the singer will be saying hello to a heritage-listed, two-story property that spans over '5100 square metres of Parramatta River frontage,' according to Domain.
Inside, there are ornate chandeliers dangling from ceilings in many rooms and the main hallway features a marble checkered floor.
A vista into the mansion's living spaces reveal wooden floors, navy blue walls, cushy furniture and even more floral embellishments.
One of the living room spaces boasts several stunning cream-coloured designer chairs, with multiple rugs laid along a hardwood floor that leads to a fireplace.
Ample room: The two-storey sandstone spans over '5100 square metres of Parramatta River frontage
Living it up! One of the living room spaces boasts several stunning cream-coloured designer chairs, with multiple rugs laid along a hardwood floor that leads to a fireplace
The love seat: Colourful sofas and seats adorn the outside where scenes of love and rejection were once shot late into the night on The Bachelor
The entire residence is illuminated by a combination of natural lighting from ceiling-high windows and several ornate powered fixtures.
Colourful sofas and seats adorn the outside where scenes of love and rejection were once shot late into the night on The Bachelor.
The massive entry doors to the property boast a stunning floral stain glass window design, opening up to a dense array of real-life forestry outside.
No roses though? The massive entry doors to the property boast a stunning floral stain glass window design, opening up to a dense array of real-life forestry outside
According to Yahoo7 Be, Derek from Kidstuff was taken aback by a chance meeting with the star.
'I said to the guy next to me, that looks exactly like Adele and I didn’t know she was in Sydney... but then I was thinking ‘hang on, she looks too much like Adele,' he told the publication.
After hearing the unmistakable British accent, the employee said he knew it was her.
'She bought $156 of some outdoor stuff, she had her son with her,' he added.
Must be her: After hearing the unmistakable British accent, a Lane Cove toy shop employee said he knew it was her, starting growing whispers the singer is staying at the Hunters Hill pad
Honeymoon pad? Reports claim Adele's tour is also an unofficial honeymoon for the singer and her long-term beau Simon Konecki, 42 (pictured in black long sleeve shirt)
Meanwhile, New Idea claims the tour is also an unofficial honeymoon for the singer and her long-term beau Simon Konecki, 42.
Their palatial rumoured residence would make quite the adequate love nest for the couple, granted they're not superstitious.
Many of the contestants The Bachelor have seen their search for romance come crashing down at the mansion, with only the first season's couple of Tim Robards and Anna Heinrich still together.
The waterside home has been owned by the McCaffrey family since 1993, when they bought it for $2.75 million.
Heartbreak hotel: Blake Garvey famously broke Sam Frost's (pictured) heart at the mansion
The survivors: The only Bachelor couple to meet at the mansion and remain together are Season 1's Anna Heinrich (L) and Tim Robards (R)
